comments.body:
A syntax like this:
/joke generic (a generic impersonal joke)
/joke victim [joker] (a joke made to scare or annoy . It may be attributed to [joker])
/joke random (a random joke, either impersonal or annoying a random player)

/joke @s about: piglin, gold, blackstone_slab, nether. result: why did the piglin cross the road? to get the gold on the other side! please add this command. also you can customize what the joke is about by using /joke about: it is optional

Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not useable by our team in its current form. Can you explain what you're looking for? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.

As for working with players, that's extremely unlikely to happen for security reasons and because the player lives mostly on the client.

As for multiple entities, you can already do that: /execute as @e run data merge entity @s {Air:0s}
I support. The current /data can only edit one entity, so we need /execute as to edit multiple entity data. Also, /data can't modify a players data, causing some inconvenience.

It would be extremely helpful for Map Makers if they could change the player's NBT Tags per data merge.

Alone changing the motion of the player would be a huge addition.
I write huge datapacks in Minecraft and I'm always sad about it........ :'(
Hi there, this feedback
YEeeeeeesssss

I'm coming at this from the opposite side; I've no problem with endermen and ravagers doing their thing, I just want to turn off creeper griefing specifically. Regardless, I completely support the idea. Disabling mob griefing should be an a la carte affair, not a one-size-fits-none that breaks large chunks of the game when you only want to disable one specific behavior.

Useful but...

There would have to be a smaller block size that the tiny versions are made of. This would be un-obtainable by the player in any way (probably). 

Unfortunately this seams pretty impossible sorry :( great idea though!
tis can make player big?

increase the limit of the attributes,

for example: scale 20 (or something like that)

In reply to comment: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360055716951/comments/360008863611

If a build is downscaled, it can get less detailed instead of having to use downscaled block sizes.
This is a very Nice idea.
This could be added to the dummy scoreboard(and a couple others), it wouldn't really work with other scoreboards

I like this, particularly because storing a string would be nice.
This would be helpful because I could store a player's name and use it in a future in like a tellraw message.
I loved this glitch, but I didnâ€™t know it was removed. ðŸ˜¢

im pretty sure if you get java, you can change the textures, and fortunately the are three wolve textures normal, angry and tamed, so if im correct if you get java and make a texture pack, you can pick three colors of wolves to use, or there are mods,
Bring Back this bug itâ€™s awesome!!

You should use a repeating command block (and have an alt account stand next to the command block to make sure it stays rendered). in the repeating command block use the command execute "Your Name" ~ ~ ~ fill ~-10 -60 ~-10 ~10 -64 ~10

This causes the fill command to run at your location.The "~" state that it is at your location and the number next to it states how far from the position the value is. Changing the "~10" to "~20" naturally increases the distance from the position by 10.
That's just a workaround though. The block limit should be removed so the user can worry about whether their computer chokes on a /fill command.

This is a no-nonsense "yes it should be increased" answer. The current limit is super, well limiting. It can only be used in small spaces. The command block suggestion, while useful is some ways, is not a reasonable solution but just a very manual workaround.

Let's use common sense please when updating the game with modern era PCs in mind. Let the user decide if their computer is good enough (most PCs these days are well fast enough to increase this limit by 100x or more). 

This is especially true now that you can change biome types (rather, you can change the area within this limited 32K blocks amount, not actually change an entire biome as you would expect it to do).

Thanks devs for updating the game with useful and common sense QOL updates!

I agree 100%. The point of /fill is to make things happen fast so you're not placing big cubes of blocks one at a time. It's supposed to make something that would other wise take 4 hours take 4 seconds, but when you have to spend the time to use the "make things happen fast" command over and over and over again then it's not a very good "make things happen fast" command. 20 minutes is certainly better than 4 hours, but it becomes a "make things happen faster than snail's pace" command instead of "make things happen fast" command.

I suggest the limit be removed entirely, or maybe have a gamerule to remove it.
I'm assuming you know this already, but this is actually possible now with the gamerule commandModificationBlockLimit :D
I agree fully. Another missing command that is crucial for many creations is the execute command that is missing so much functionality in bedrock.
Yes. You cannot summon a mob with armor with set enchantments on bedrock edition but you can on java.
I 100% agree! I love doing fun shenanigans with my friends, but due to the lack of certain commands, it can be very difficult or in some cases, impossible.
We have that. The command is /gamerule showtags [true,false]
/gamerule showtags doesn't work for this, it's for something... else..

Ive been looking for a way to do something like this with plugins but i dont know how to do it without making a custom one by my self or paying someone to do it as with /vanish other opped players are able to see vanished players names in tab, i support for and vote on this post and i hope it gets more votes!

what if with that theres a toggleable option where you can choose to where if that option above was on "hide for own team" or "never" where you can choose to see yourself in tab or not see yourself in tab.

I agree with this, but to stay consistent with the way that Minecraft commands work, the syntax for using scoreboards with this should be in the form of /execute store:

execute store result attribute <target> <attribute> base <scale> -> execute
execute store result attribute <target> <attribute> modifier <uuid> <name> <scale> -> execute

I'm also happy with this setup because it brings meaning to the Name property of attributes.
And the name should be "noPearlDamage" since it is logical.
the name should be EnderPearlDamage.
it should be named as PearlDamage
Mojang need to update this so we can use custom enchants on bedrock edition as it's unfair that all the other platforms other than xbox and playstation have it add custom enchants mojang
Agreed, they need to change this ASAP. Also with the ability to change the NBT data. There needs to be an official way to do this without using 3rd party software

Already possible, although very tedious. A gamerule for singleplayer would be helpful. :)

Run your map on a dedicated server with command blocks disabled in server.properties.

If you're playing in older versions of Minecraft, mainly up to Java Edition 1.12, you could use MCEdit to get rid of the offending command block.

I agree with your idea, though perhaps the gamerule should be named something like disableCommandBlocks

If you are playing on the Minecraft that is the Better Together Update (cross platform between different devices), then you can pause the game and scroll down to the bottom of the setting game menu and you can disable command blocks.
Perhaps for internal consistency, call it /gamerule disableCommandBlocks
i hate this so much i had a year old world but i made a mistake with a command block and it just had to be deleted
I have run into this Problem So many Times and It is always a pain to spend half an hour trying to retrieve a world all because you typed @a instead of @s. Please Add this To Java!!
Just do /gamerule commandblocksenabled false then go and break the command block. And then turn commands back on again.

Format:

/Morph [target:target] [seconds: int]

/Morph Undo

/Morph [playername] [seconds: int]

/Effect <player:target> Morph [seconds: int] 

I love your idea
Damn straight.

True! I really want this, I'm trying to make a build, and want to place a build in my world
but I can't so I have to make the build from scratch D:
I so wish this was on console as well

I would also like to have this feature added.  I know that Microsoft has the hard drives files locked out or hidden.  Maybe Mojang could allow this by using the users profile folder location instead of the default Minecraft install folder(s)
I agree

This would help a lot to keep the "swimming" animation over slabs and other incomplete blocks. Currently I use a barrier block on the player and the shulker but this is not able to make them completely invisible.
Agreed! I always wanted the attribute command to be in bedrock/pocket edition!

You do realize /attribute does things like change movement speed, knockback resistance, armor toughness(even when you're not wearing armor), and other things about yourself. The put a button on your head thing is used with /replaceitem, not /attribute. Some find the button maps would be impossible if you had to use something else to put a button on your head.

I have been trying to make a addon that adds a few different weapons all with different things about them like one that is fast but does a little damage and another that reaches far but is slow. All I need to do it is just the ability command... we don't want to remake the wheel, but without the attribute command we do need to
I NEED IT! i want to make giants that work, i want it in bedrock, we should get cut some slack too ya know.
/attribute should be added to the Bedrock edition for console at least, because I'm not sure if it's on PC, as I don't play on PC.

This would be helpful especially since music.game, music.game.creative, and music.game.nether are all random. They could add music.sweden or music.blind_spots and more as separate music options. Thereâ€™s also a glitch in which if you play music, it would play two different tracks at once.
I like the idea. But I think that the music should at least follow the player so it doesn't quiet down when they try to move away from the music like the sounds do. But none the less, great idea
I would also love an option to loop the music. Like, set a specific time (min,sec) for it to loop back to when the song ends.
You can actually make it "follow" the player by setting it's volume to something really loud like 1,000,000. It will stick to the max volume and not get quiter

You can make it so the music follows the player, that's not the problem. The problem about the music is that you can't pick a specific song some of the time. You can pick something like "play a song that plays in this biome". If you want C418's Mice on Venus to play for instance, you'd have to use a resource pack that adds the song, and use the playsound command to target that. It's a bit faffy.

This shouldn't be implemented as some servers have regular players in creative mode for building or something, and they shouldn't all be given access to cheats (which is what command blocks effectively do).
Only when you are OP or cheats are enabled.
It is not allowing me to ride a mob
this isn't a real command (yet), but hopefully eventually it will be, sorry

This is another great example of a Java exclusive feature that Bedrock should have as a top priority. I ask anyone whoâ€™s reading this to vote on this post, and make your own posts of bringing Bedrock up to speed on commands.

Also, thanks for helping me out on my earlier post @The Fuzzy Cub. Please try to bring up your Bedrock Edition command updating posts to other map creators who want the same thing. This way, Bedrock command updating will get more votes and become Mojangâ€™s top priority.

I would like the command tag of /minecartspeed <speed factor>

 

The tag speed factor is max speed in meters per second. This would make my roller coasters and rail traveling speed phenomenal!

This would be great, but it should also apply to boats as well.  (and instead of a command it could be and nbt tag)

 

 

p.s. can you change the description to be a suggestion for both bedrock AND java?
You can already adjust minecart speed with Behaviour Packs.
This should probably be put into nbt if it where to be added instead of being it's own command
this would be cool in java too
I'm agree with you, I think that it's necessary to Bedrock Edition to make it easier write coordinates.

It may not seem that useful, but the tabs make commands super easy because you can use tab to collect the coordinates of one corner of a fill/clone area, run the command (it fails), then pull up the old command and tab the second corner.
It is added in 1.13 :D
